required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Hyaluronic Acid Effect on Xenogenic Bone Healing
clinical_study.official_title: Hyaluronic Acid Effect on Xenogenic Bone Substitutes Healing During Ridge Preservations: A Radiological and Histomorphometric Study

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study is to test the hyaluronic acid hydrogel impact on the healing acceleration of xenogenic bone substitutes used in ridge preservation.
Following tooth extraction, bone particles are mixed with the hyaluronic acid gel and grafted in the tooth socket. at the implant placement phase, a cone beam computer assisted tomography file is recorded in order to compare it with the baseline and a biopsy to evaluate the histological consequences.

primary_outcome.measure: Radiological assessement of the boe resorption
primary_outcome.description: the baseline if the CBCT is compared to the 4 months post-op to assess the bone resorption
During implant placement, a bone biopsy is harvested and stained with different colorants to assess microscopically the biological healing

arm_group.description: Two CBCTs were recorded and compared, one at the baseline and the other at 4 months post-op. The bone resorption was quantified and analyzed using ITK-SNAP software
During implant placement (4 months after the bone grafting), a bone biopsy is collected and stained with several colorants to analyze the biological bone healing

intervention.intervention_name: Ridge preservation: Tooth extration and immediat bone grafting in the socket
intervention.description: Following the tooth extraction, the socket is filled with a mixture of xenogenic bone and hyaluronic acid and sealed with an epithelio-connective arrested from the maxillary palate

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients in need of tooth extraction and willing to receive dental implants in the extraction site
- Presence of two mono radicular teeth in need of extraction
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with systemic diseases
- Patients under 8 years and above 60 years.
- Presence of endodontic or periodontal lesion in the extraction sites
